channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: Chiral phonons in polar LiNbO<sub>3</sub>
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 05 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66911-5

The authors demonstrate the existence of chiral phonons in a non-chiral ferroelectric material, opening the possibility for phonon chirality control through ferroic switching of the electric polarization.
item.dc:title: Chiral phonons in polar LiNbO<sub>3</sub>
item.dc:creator: Hiroki Ueda
Abhishek Nag
Carl P. Romao
Mirian García-Fernández
Ke-Jin Zhou
Urs Staub

item.title: Advancing aerogel recyclability through polyhexahydrotriazine reactivity
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 05 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67059-y

The sustainable use of organic aerogels is limited by their non-recyclability owing to the covalently-crosslinked networks that constitute their structures. Here, the authors report on the dynamic chemistry of hexahydrotriazine units to develop recyclable aerogels.
item.dc:title: Advancing aerogel recyclability through polyhexahydrotriazine reactivity
item.dc:creator: Chang-Lin Wang
Yi-Ru Chen
Brahim Mezari
Fabian Eisenreich
Željko Tomović

item.title: Electron-conductive binder for silicon negative electrode enabling low-pressure all-solid-state batteries
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 05 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66851-0

Silicon negative electrode in all-solid-state batteries can lose electrical contact at low stack pressure, reducing performance. Here, the authors introduce a conductive, water-processable polymer binder that preserves contact and supports stable operation at low stack pressure.
item.dc:title: Electron-conductive binder for silicon negative electrode enabling low-pressure all-solid-state batteries
item.dc:creator: Seunggoo Jun
Minseok Jeong
Boyeong Jang
Seong-hyeon Jung
Young Joon Park
Yong Bae Song
Jisoo Park
Seungyun Jo
Du Yeol Ryu
